image.altText: David Cameron in a navy suit.

props.synopsis: British Foreign Secretary David Cameron warns a Chinese blockade of Taiwan would cripple the global economy as he asks Israel to show restraint in Rafah.

title.children: 'Global dashboard flashing red': Former British PM's stark warning of impending conflict

image.altText: Black and white image of a tall man in a suit

props.synopsis: Former NBL player Tiny Pinder is sentenced to eight years' jail and will likely be deported over two violent sexual assaults.

title.children: Disgraced basketballer Tiny Pinder sentenced to eight years' jail, visa cancelled over sexual assaults

image.altText: Photographs of a report pages laying on a table

props.synopsis: An independent report into government spending finds hundreds of millions of dollars were allocated to sporting and community projects without any evidence of them being rigorously assessed.

title.children: WA Labor promised $298 million to local sports projects. A new audit has found only $36m was justified

image.altText: A group of people stand together.

props.synopsis: Nearly five weeks after 39 suspected asylum seekers were found in Beagle Bay, advocates have been communicating with the men on Nauru.

title.children: Refugee advocates make contact with group who landed in Western Australia's far north

image.altText: A drone picture showing brown and green murky water along the Mullaloo coastline.

props.synopsis: Murky and discoloured water at Mullaloo Beach in Perth's north is being blamed on a faulty piece of equipment used to construct a marina nearby.

title.children: Murky water at a Perth beach is being blamed on faulty equipment, but locals arenâ€™t convinced

image.altText: A road sign as a road train drives past.

props.synopsis: A 62-year-old cyclist has died, and another has been flown to Perth with serious injuries, after separate crashes in WA's remote eastern Goldfields.

title.children: Cyclist killed, another seriously injured in crashes on Eyre Highway in outback Western Australia

image.altText: the exterior of a white apartment building

props.synopsis: Netstrata managing director Stephen Brell stands aside as the president of the NSW industry peak body in the wake of an ABC investigation into his firm.

title.children: Netstrata managing director stands aside from peak body after ABC investigation

image.altText: Princess Kate smiles wearing a red blazer.

props.synopsis: Sir Keir Starmer, the man widely touted to become Britain's next prime minister, urges people to "butt out" and leave Kate Middleton alone, amid wild speculation about her health.

title.children: 'Butt out': Man touted to be Britain's next PM wants wild speculation about Princess Kate's health to end

image.altText: A group of St Kilda AFL players huddle around a teammate who has kicked a vital goal.

props.synopsis: St Kilda clinches an impressive 15-point win over the still winless Collingwood, as Jack Higgins kicks a controversial boundary-line classic to ice the game.

title.children: Saints plunge 'sloppy, rusty, clunky' Pies into crisis as Higgins slots controversial match-winner

image.altText: A Socceroos player is surrounded by teammates congratulating him after a goal.

props.synopsis: Injuries to Riley McGree and Jordy Bos take the shine off the Socceroos' 2-0 World Cup qualifying win over Lebanon in Sydney.

title.children: Injuries sour Socceroos' win over Lebanon in World Cup qualifier

image.altText: Signage inside the Corruption and Crime Commission office in Perth, white text on black background with WA coat of arms

props.synopsis: An investigation into Western Australia's anti-corruption agency finds one of its own officers went "rogue" when she began an intimate relationship with an informant.

title.children: Corruption watchdog officer went 'rogue' and hid intimate relationship with informant, inquiry finds

image.altText: A close-up of Prince Harry who wears a suit and has a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for Prince Harry allege the royal and his mother both had calls unlawfully intercepted by the staff of Rupert Murdoch'sÂ News Group Newspapers (NGN) tabloids.

title.children: Rupert Murdoch-owned tabloids accessed messages from Princess Diana's pager, lawyers for Prince Harry allege

image.altText: Anthony Albanese walks out of a church after a Good Friday service.

props.synopsis: An independent review into protecting LGBT staff and students at religious schools is now complete, but the government's own plans are no clearer.

title.children: Major report on LGBT discrimination in schools prompts anger from faith groups, government response unclear

image.altText: Penny Wong looks up in the Senate

props.synopsis: This week Don Farrell found himself in a "bit of trouble", Kevin Rudd tried dodging a Trump-sized iceberg, deadly political consequences loomed amid a debate on religion and the Liberals's woman problem returned with a vengeance, writes Brett Worthington.Â Â

title.children: Honeymoon's over for Penny Wong, literally, as a Trump-sized iceberg threatens the HMAS Albanese

image.altText: A close-up photo of a man in a gingham shirt

props.synopsis: Alexei Navalny's former aide says a Russian court refused the lawsuit because the late opposition leader did not file the complaint himself.

title.children: Russian court rejects Alexei Navalny mother's case alleging improper medical care prior to death, ally says

image.altText: A man stands smiling at the camera in a blue shirt

props.synopsis: Wiradjuri man Brandon Rich died while being taken into police custody in 2021, but earlier strategic thinking may have delivered a different outcome.

title.children: Coroner urges de-escalation focus in domestic and family violence training for NSW police

image.altText: A bunch of Australian bank notes.

props.synopsis: By tracking this suite of labour market indicators, we'll have an idea of how the Albanese government's full employment ambitions are going, writes Gareth Hutchens.

title.children: Why the government wants you to be thinking beyond the headline unemployment rate

image.altText: A man with glasses with green plants in the background

props.synopsis: James Valentine's first inkling that all was not right happened at a friend's birthday party. Now the ABC presenter has something he needs to tell us.

title.children: Trouble wolfing down a curry was James Valentine's first clue something was wrong. In a few weeks, his oesophagus will be removed

image.altText: A woman with her head in her hands in front f a glowing sunset

props.synopsis: The majority of Australians have lived through a climate disaster and they are increasingly afraid of having to move away from the place they live due to extreme weather events, a new survey by the Climate Council shows.

title.children: Australians fear moving from where they live due to climate disasters

image.altText: The foreign ministers stand in front of Chinese and Australian flags as they shake hands

props.synopsis: An old Chinese idiomÂ perfectly encapsulates the essence of Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi's current visit to Australia, and his priorities reveal Beijing's willingness to re-engage directly with business leaders, writes Bang Xiao.

title.children: Forget about politics, Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi is in Australia for business

image.altText: An Australian women's cricketer looks up into the stands after hitting a six as a Bangladesh wicketkeeper watches.

props.synopsis: Australia has a winning start to the women's ODI series against Bangladesh, but it takes a brilliant late cameo from all-rounder Alana King to set up a solid total in Dhaka.

title.children: Smashing Alana King cameo sets up Australia ODI win against Bangladesh

image.altText: An elderly white man beams happily from the driver's seat of a shiny new car under lights.

props.synopsis: The new standards will avoid more than 7 billion tonnes of planet-warming carbon emissions during the next three decades and provide nearly $151 billion in annual net benefits, according to the EPA â€” but they could be rolled back if Donald Trump is returned to office.

title.children: Biden administration issues new rules aimed at cutting vehicle carbon emissions, boosting EV sales

image.altText: Two men sit in a room

props.synopsis: Noland Arbaugh, who is paralysed from below the shoulder, used the Neuralink chip to play online chess, saying the technology had given him the ability to play video games again.Â

title.children: First patient of Elon Musk's brain chip implant shown playing online chess with his mind

image.altText: Emeriates airliner in flight

props.synopsis: It's allegedÂ Mohamed Ahmed Omer secretly withdrew sponsorship for his then-wife's partner visa before booking a trip overseas. He allegedly returned with the couple's children, leaving the woman stranded and unable to return to Australia for almost two years.

title.children: Melbourne man on trial for exit trafficking after allegedly leaving wife stranded overseas without passport

image.altText: A number of people cross an intersection in Brisbane's CBD. Behind them are office buildings.

props.synopsis: The biggest monthly surge in employment outside of the COVID pandemic period has seen the unemployment rate tumble back to levels not seen since September last year.

title.children: Huge jobs gains raise risk of higher interest rates for longer, economists warn

image.altText: Twisted metal of a broken power transmission tower

props.synopsis: WA's Shadow Energy Minister says the Goldfields is facing the prospect of more blackouts next summer, with the government's plans to improve the reliability of the grid to take at least two years.

title.children: Fallout from WA's nine-day blackout continues as government defends two-year wait for a fix

image.altText: 4 white babies on a white bed sheet. They are each wearing differently coloured pastel onesies.

props.synopsis: Parents of triplets and quadruplets say they're struggling to make ends meet, calling on the federal government to expand support for families of multiples.

title.children: Parents of twins, triplets, quadruplets call for support from government and more paid parental leave

image.altText: orca and inset of sperm whale tale

props.synopsis: Observers look on in amazement as sperm whales off WA's southern coast successfully defend themselves from a pod of attacking killer whales by defecating at will, creating a "cloud of diarrhoea".

title.children: Sperm whales drop 'bubble of poo' off WA to prevent orca attack in rarely recorded encounter

image.altText: Chris field in a red flowery shirt smiling and looking at two women holding a doll.

props.synopsis: As WA ombudsman Chris Field stands down as its president, anÂ international organisation distances itself from overseas travel which has seen him come under the scrutiny of the state's corruption body.

title.children: Expensive overseas travel by WA ombudsman not expected or commissioned, says international body he led

image.altText: Man and woman smile and look at camera.

props.synopsis: The rare snake bite death of a Townsville dad has highlighted a retired catcher's concerns about the risks of untrained handlers trying to relocate the venomous reptiles.

title.children: Father killed by snake bite at childcare centre was 'doing his very best to keep the children safe'

image.altText: A man at a workbench cuts a piece of engineered stone. He wears a full head covering.

props.synopsis: Builders and suppliers of engineered stone say their industries are crippled by confusion and a lack of detail from government about the impending ban on engineered stone.

title.children: Upcoming ban on engineered stone creates confusion as 'nobody knows what they're allowed to do'

image.altText: Saline drip

props.synopsis: The girl's parents believed treatment was unrealistic due to her severe epilepsy and development delays, and Autistic Spectrum Disorder, and wanted palliative care instead.

title.children: Despite parents' wishes, NSW court orders life-saving cancer treatment to teenager with severe disabilities

image.altText: A Honda SUV on fire on a suburban street.

props.synopsis: A 72-year-old man was struck on his morning walk in the Brisbane suburb of Chermside and later died in hospital.Â

title.children: Driver in fatal alleged hit-and-run in Brisbane went to work after allegedly setting car alight, police say

image.altText: A digitally altered image of Kate Middleton and her kids, Louis, George and Charlotte, to have a green and yellow background

props.synopsis: How the royal family has tried to use social media over the years to increase their popularity â€¦ and failed spectacularly.Â

title.children: Do the Royals think they're 'above' the internet?

image.altText: Donald Trump's face pictured against a backdrop of red and white horizonal stripes

props.synopsis: Now he's the Republicans' presumptive presidential nominee, Donald Trump's in full campaign mode, and his comments are proving as divisive as ever. We take a close look at what he's been saying he'll do if he's given another term in the White House.

title.children: 'I am your retribution': This is Trump's vision for America, in his own words
